products.facts: ["200 g is often used as a standard measurement for various food products, ensuring consistency in recipes.","Materials weighing 200 g can include organic and non-organic substances, impacting their ecological footprint based on sourcing and production methods.","In terms of quality, products weighing 200 g can vary widely; it's essential to check for certifications like organic or fair trade to ensure sustainability.","The ecological impact of a 200 g product can be assessed by considering its packaging, transportation, and lifecycle, promoting awareness of environmental sustainability."]

products.name: Extra Virgin Olive Oil
products.labels: Premiere-pression-a-froid, Vierge-extra, No GMOs, Non GMO project
products.facts: ["Extra Virgin Olive Oil is made from the first cold pressing of olives, ensuring minimal processing and retaining natural flavors.","It is rich in antioxidants and healthy monounsaturated fats, contributing to heart health and reducing inflammation.","The production of Extra Virgin Olive Oil can promote sustainable agricultural practices, as olive trees require less water and are often grown in diverse ecosystems.","Quality Extra Virgin Olive Oil is certified by various organizations, often requiring specific acidity levels (below 0.8%) and taste tests to ensure premium quality."]

products.name: Redbull
products.categories: Beverages, Carbonated drinks, Sodas, Energy drinks, Sweetened beverages, Carbonated Sodas
products.facts: ["Red Bull contains caffeine, taurine, B vitamins, and sugar or artificial sweeteners depending on the variant.","The company has committed to reducing its carbon footprint by using recyclable materials for its cans and promoting sustainable practices.","Red Bull's quality control processes ensure that each can meets strict safety and quality standards before reaching consumers.","The energy drink is produced in over 170 countries, contributing to a significant global supply chain."]

products.labels: Organic, EU Organic, GB-ORG-05, No added sugar, Soil Association Organic
products.facts: ["Yoghurt - 950g is typically made from milk, which can be sourced from cows, goats, or plant-based alternatives.","Many brands of yoghurt use recyclable packaging, contributing to reduced environmental impact.","Yoghurt is a source of probiotics, which are beneficial for gut health and overall quality of life.","The quality of yoghurt can be determined by its live cultures, which should be present in significant amounts for health benefits."]
